title: Strictly's Dianne Buswell defends Dev Griffin after horror fall
text:
Dianne was rushed to hospital (Picture: PA)

Strictly Come Dancing professional Dianne Buswell has tweeted her thanks to fans and defended dancing partner Dev Griffin after she was landed on her head after an eight-foot drop.

Taking to Twitter, she shared: ‘Morning everybody thank you for all the lovely msgs of concern.

‘We had an accident keyword being accident it was not devs fault at all these things happen.

‘But great news is I’m fine and we both can not wait to dance tonight xxxx thanks again for your thoughts and well wishes.’

Her words of encouragement come after it was reported Dev dropped her during rehearsals and she was rushed to hospital with Dev ‘doubled over in panic’ after the dancer came crashing to the floor.

Dianne Buswell and Dev Griffin are some of the frontrunners (Picture: PA)

An insider said: ‘Dev let her slip from his grasp and Dianne fell and landed on her head.

Advertisement

Advertisement

‘It couldn’t have been worse. It was horrible to watch Dianne lying prostrate on the floor…

‘Dev… was praying that there was no serious damage — the worst-case scenario was that she had some internal head injuries.’

But it turns out there was no damage, and Dianne was discharged with whiplash.

Dianne and Dev have been one of the frontrunners of the competition, earning a total score of 49 points across the first two live shows.

It isn’t the only accident to have hit the competition this year, with Jamie Laing forced to pull out after injuring his foot.

Strictly Come Dancing continues Saturday on BBC One at 7.10pm.

MORE: Britain’s Got Talent’s Amanda Holden brands Bello and Annaliese Nock ‘most dangerous act ever’ in tense final
description: Dianne Buswell was rushed to hospital after being dropped during rehearsals.
